dt: {bc}a metamorphic crystalline rock that has a closely foliated structure and can be split along approximately parallel planes

et: borrowed from French {it}schiste{/it} (Middle French {it}pierre schiste,{/it} with {it}pierre{/it} "stone"), borrowed from Latin {it}schistos{/it} (in Pliny's {it}Naturalis historia{/it}) "a kind of iron ore, perhaps limonite," shortened from {it}lapis schistos,{/it} literally, "fissile stone," from {it}lapis{/it} "stone" + {it}schistos{/it} "easily split, fissile," borrowed from Greek {it}schistós{/it} "split, divided," verbal adjective of {it}schízein{/it} "to split, separate" {ma}{mat|shed:1|}{/ma}
shortdef: a metamorphic crystalline rock that has a closely foliated structure and can be split along approximately parallel planes
